intro: Pimelea rara, commonly known as the rare waratah, is a shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, needle-like leaves and is typically found in heathland and open forest habitats. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which is known for its showy floral displays and ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pimelea rara is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
